intro: Bradleia coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved bradleia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to reddish in color, often arranged in clusters. Bradleia coriacea thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique foliage and subtle floral display make it a notable plant in its native habitat.
